Line 85: Line 85:
== Arrests ==
== Arrests ==
â
Rights activists have said that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Meanwhile, sources at the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], said a number of the groupâs members have been detained in Mohandessin before heading to join "25th" demonstration<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. [[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son was taken by an unmarked car.{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}} Security forces in Cairo beat and arrested Jack Shenker, a ''[[The Guardian|Guardian]]'' news reporter, who secretly recorded his subsequent journey in a police van. <ref>Jack Shenker, [http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/audio/2011/jan/26/egypt-violence-jack-shenker-arrest-audio "Egypt protests: 'People are being hauled out by police and beaten' - audio"], guardian.co.uk, 26 January 2011</ref>
+
Rights activists have said that security agents have detained a number of protesters who were taking part in the "25th" demonstration. Twenty-five people have been arrested at [[Assiut]]<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut">{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-govt-security-detains-protesters-cairo-and-assiut|title=Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut|publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]]|date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref>. According to Gamal Eid, director of the [[Arab Network for Human Rights Information]] (ANHRI). He noted that security agents seized banners hoisted by the protesters<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Security sources said that Assuit's police arrested approximately 50 young people the night before "25th" demonstration and confined them in central security trucks<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. Meanwhile, sources at the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], said a number of the groupâs members have been detained in Mohandessin before heading to join "25th" demonstration<ref name="Egypt govt security detains protesters in Cairo and Assiut"/>. [[Ayman Nour]], the founder of the liberal opposition [[El-Ghad Party]], has tweeted that his son was taken by an unmarked car<ref name="We ran a gauntlet of officers beating us with sticks">{{cite web|author=Jack Shenker|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/jan/26/egypt-protests|title=Egypt protests: 'We ran a gauntlet of officers beating us with sticks'|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|date=2011-01-26 |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref>. Security forces in Cairo beat and arrested Jack Shenker, a ''[[The Guardian|Guardian]]'' news reporter, who secretly recorded his subsequent journey in a police van<ref name="People are being hauled out by police and beaten">{{cite web|author=Jack Shenker|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/audio/2011/jan/26/egypt-violence-jack-shenker-arrest-audio|title=Egypt protests: 'People are being hauled out by police and beaten' - audio"|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|date=2011-01-26 |accessdate=2011-01-26}}</ref>.
